website_summaries.verdict: Affordable quality and an array of colors make this large set of cat nail caps a solid choice for budget-conscious cat owners in need of an effective scratching solution.
pros: Soft and flexible without being flimsy
Comes with 5 colors, extra adhesive, and easy to use applicators
Following a brief adjustment period, most cats seem perfectly comfortable wearing these
cons: Sizes run a bit large, but length can easily be trimmed for a better fit

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. They were easy to put on, they’ve been on all 3 of my cats for a week now with no issues. And the colors are so cute! They give you plenty of glue, I used 1 tube for 3 cats and the tube isn’t empty yet. These pictures were taken about a half hour after putting them on, so you can see how bothersome they are.... not at all! I only wish you were able to pick what colors you want when ordering but the colors I got are fine (purple glitter, black, blue, clear, pink)
customer_reviews.author: dominique

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ME OR MY CAT!
customer_reviews.text: It seems incredibly wrong to superglue plastic covers over cats nails. It was so sad to see my cat not be able to walk correctly after the stressful (for me and the cat) application. EVEN WORSE: It is superglue! You cannot get them off easily! You just leave them with the cat miserable. I returned these and do not recommend them. I would advise a pet nail cutter and a short YouTube video as to how to trim the nails.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Burned my cat!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! The glue burned my kittens nail beds. Currently at the vet and 600.00 later in Bill's. Never again. I tested the glue on myself and it definitely burns.
customer_reviews.author: Kim wathen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: They're great! I've previously used other brands of nail caps, but they're more expensive and they bring less than this pack does. This one brings 5 sets of 20 nail caps, 5 tubes of glue, 3 glue tips/applicators, and the instructions. They were pretty easy to put on since my cat has previously used them. But if you're having trouble, a treat should help them behave while you slip these on. So far they hold up nicely and they look super cute! My cat is a 9 (almost 10) pound, 4 year old domestic short hair and a size small fit her nails perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: They are perfect so far
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and effective. I have two kitties. I needed an extra person to help get all the claws covered in one sitting. One kitty didn’t seem to mind, and one spent about an hour trying to bite them off. All the caps are still on despite his effort. I am hoping these last as long as expected. I will update this in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lea Dani

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The pack I bought from PetSmart for $15 lasted us almost three months before I pulled them off to put these on. I alternated between the orange this pack came with and the sparkly black I got from PetSmart. I used the same glue on each nail and literally took less then two weeks for all the orange nails to fall off but her black ones are still on for Halloween. Thought I was going to save myself money but I guess I’m out $10 because this was an absolute waste. I hope other people have better luck then we did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I thought I’d try these instead of buying the soft claw brand as I have been. Don’t waste your money on these. My cat was able to get these off in the same day. The material is not strong so there were small bits everywhere. I’ll stick with the soft claws from now on
customer_reviews.author: Linda D

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF GLUE!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! This glue burns! My cat was protesting and I thought he was just mad about the toe caps, wrong! I got some glue on my finger and it instantly started burning. I feel terrible that I subjected my cat to this. These toe caps aren’t very good quality anyway. There’s no consistency with quality. Some caps are thick and some are paper thing.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Marshall

customer_reviews.title: These are the best. The ones at petsmart are terrible
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. The ones at petsmart are terrible. Be careful with the glue, if you are not precise you can get their fur in it and it’s not nice to remove. They last a solid 4 weeks on my cat who did not chew them off. Because these are a softer silicone your cat can chew them in half if they don’t like them. Every animal is different. These did not effect walking jumping or litter box use. Life as usual. Just can’t scratch!
customer_reviews.author: Heather T.

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and save money buying these instead of the name brand!
customer_reviews.text: I got a new couch and have SIX cats (yeah, crazy cat lady here), so I needed to cap the nails! These work just as well as the name brand product, comes in a convenient storage case, and has lots of glue and nails for lots of applications. My cats like to chew them off, but with the extra nails that’s not an issue. I just have to reapply them. I had to do the same with the name brand caps, so this is what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine J.

customer_reviews.title: Wearing of tips
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this happens with all nail caps or just this brand but the ends wore off or were chewed off after a week.....However they have all stayed on so far and even with the ends worn off he is unable to do damage with his claws. I did not know if my cat would tolerate them so this was perfect for me because the price was right. They were a little big for my nine-month-old kitten. I purchased the small. I’m wondering if the extra length had something to do with the wearing of the tips 🤔.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: On point
customer_reviews.text: At first they were a bit tricky to get on the boys, but once you get the hang of it you can again join everyone else in being able to have nice things I.e. a sofa, wool rugs, etc
customer_reviews.author: Tangrs

customer_reviews.title: Good caps
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using this brand of nail caps. The brand I usually use was not currently available. The only difference in these are that some of the caps are a little on the thick side which makes them a little harder to use. The thinner ones slip over the nail easier and are more pliable. First time my new kitten has wore caps and she isn’t bothered by them at all. Might be my go to brand if my old one doesn’t come back in stock.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: My Wife Suggested These...
customer_reviews.text: I am really surprised with this product. I initially thought these were a gimmick. Well we have two cats, both wear these very well. The initial day or so they tried their best to chew them off. Today, they wear them fine. We easily replace them if they shed a nail and we couldn't be happier. My couch thanks us daily...
customer_reviews.author: T Woods

customer_reviews.title: Work very well!  Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: We put these on two of our cats who were destroying the wallpaper and the leather furniture. We were afraid they would really bother the cats, especially my neurotic tuxedo cat. They didn’t mind them at all! I am shocked at how well it all worked out! This kit includes plenty of glue and the nails stay on very well. The caps only come off when our cats shed their nails. We only put them on their front claws. I would highly recommend these caps for any cats who don’t go outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Retz

customer_reviews.title: Maybe try more scratching posts first.
customer_reviews.text: I used these on my four housecats for a year or more. While certainly preferable to cruel options like declawing, they weren’t ideal. You really need to keep on top of it to make sure they’re not growing into their paw pads as their claws grow out, and trim them off regularly. For the perfect solution: I ended up going back to weekly claw trimming, and buying a few more scratching posts. They’re doing a great job using the scratching posts instead of the furniture, their paws don’t hurt, and everyone is happier. I’d recommend trying that before going to the soft paws/soft claws.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for you cats claws. Not  Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 1 star because they look cute for a little bit.. But only 1 stars just because of that. These suck! It's been weeks already they have either started falling off or staying on but then just the ends exposed. To me these Irritate the cats alot To where they dig at the ground just trying to get them off.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: Get stronger glue
customer_reviews.text: I like these, but I don't like the glue that comes with them. I ended up using Gorilla brand super glue and these covers stay on much better. I also don't clip my cat's claws before I put them on, because I feel like that defeats the purpose of using these. Because the tips of her claws are sharp it kind of wears down the tip of the covers, but we never have a sharp claw coming through. Also, it took several months, but now she doesn't fight me when I put them on. Those first few months were no fun for anyone when it came time to put the covers on :)
customer_reviews.author: ap

customer_reviews.title: Our poor kitties..
customer_reviews.text: I only managed to get these on to two nails of one of our cats and three of our other cat's nails. Big mistake even then. The cats hated them so much that they ripped them off along with huge parts of their nails. Damaged them pretty good. I feel terrible. This company did give me my money back so I appreciate that, but I can say that I honestly don't recommend them for a wild cat, a timid cat, or any sort of picky cat. They may hurt themselves trying to remove them. It is nail glue and we all know that can damaged our nails.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Cool!!!! And, they work!!!
customer_reviews.text: These tips were put on my two cats and stay adhered pretty good! They do try to pull them off, but they rarely can. At first, the cats kind of walked funny, but now, they are part of the claw! They are time consuming to put on and my son got scratched a few times. It's best if you are well set up and have two people, if possible. If you have cats that are edgy, two people are a must! They look very cool, work like a charm, and now, my cats can jump on my couch and I don't freak out! No more holes in my leather couch!
customer_reviews.author: wredwritinghood

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my cat
customer_reviews.text: This was cute but a bad idea, one the application is not easy, my cat kept puling away and with good reason! but after they were on she had started walking differently, then the covers wouldn't come off because it was superglued to her! The grow out period was slow and long and painful. Do not use.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: Price worth the risk of unknown colors.
customer_reviews.text: Our lil man is pretty as can be in his nails. For price point it was worth the risk that we wouldn't get gender specific colors. But nugget is a cat and I doubt cares that he has sparkly pink claws. I on the other hand think they are adorable and a great solution to help in his triaining as he learns what he can and can't claw. No real issue putting them on, but have used claw covers in the past. It also included back, purple, yellow and blue....i still choose to use the pink sparkle, again he's a cat and doesn't care, so he's dressed to impress mom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for kitties that were fighting. I put them on while they were sleeping. Glue is super strong.. I may have glued my fingers together a few times lol 😅 These lasted a while but the boys kept trying to chew them off. They're not fighting as violently as before so I won't be reapplying them but its a good option to have. I also got the smallest size and trrimed them with scissors before applying since they were still a little too big.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey H

customer_reviews.title: Be patient and give yourself and your cat a timeout if it doesn't work at first.
customer_reviews.text: We use the soft pet cat nail covers to protect our furniture from kitten claws. We also use them for our medium size cat because she scratches herself due to skin sensitivity issues. Neither of them have any issues wearing the Soft nail covers. It is a two person job, but the results are worth it and a better alternative to declawing. Our vet also approves of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lattemom

customer_reviews.title: Product is nice if you have a lot of patience and time
customer_reviews.text: Product is nice if you have a lot of patience and time. Packaging is nice. However Can not keep them on my cats claws. Very difficult to put on, ended up haveing dried glue on my fingers for several days. Very time consuming, just to have cat chew them off overnight.
customer_reviews.author: joseaphine

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful!! Compared to the popular pet store brand, these adhered too much. They didn’t fall off and my cat’s nails continued to grow until they were pressed against his paws (they grow curved in) I’m not saying don’t buy, but be very mindful of how much glue you use. They *should* fall off in a few weeks to give you a chance to trim their nails. I had to cut them off and that’s not easy with a fussy cat. What I did like compared to the popular pet store brand was that they were more flexible so you could pinch them open to drop in the drops of glue.
customer_reviews.author: Brent T. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: A little TOO soft
customer_reviews.text: These are soft and comfy for the cats as advertised, but the material is a little TOO soft. I previously bought Kitty Kaps brand caps when I initially tried capping their claws, and liked it, so went ahead and bought this bulk pack. Unlike with those initial Kitty Kaps, my cats are able to nibble the ends off of these caps and expose the points of their claws.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Sized a little big
customer_reviews.text: These nail caps are sized a little larger than ones I've bought in the past. The mediums are huge, and I had to return those for the smalls. The smalls are even still big for my 9 lb cat. Either she has tiny little nails, or the size chart needs adjusting. I still used them, and they stayed on okay. But, because the ends are wider it gave her an easier way to get them off. They are good quality, not too thin. I'll probably order again, but maybe try to extra small.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Work great!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by our vet, as our cat was destroying our walls and furniture, and as I was very skeptical about these. I would absolutely recommend. At first our cat was totally freaked out but after a few days she didn't pay to much attention to them. But the scratching completely stopped, she would try and give up as nothing would happen. They also add some extra spice to cats paws. They lasted almost a month before starting to fall off. But for the price you get plenty for awhile. We also only stuck them on the front paws and not the back paws so they will last even longer. Very easy to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriell

customer_reviews.title: Cute, they work if applied correctly
customer_reviews.text: These work once they are on, and they actually aren’t that tricky to put on. Our cats mostly cooperated but then did continue to test to bite them off. Could have been user error, I wondered if I pushed them up too far so it was uncomfortable? But that’s the only tricky thing - they can be applied in a way that doesn’t work And your car is unhappy. They are cute though and once my cats stopped biting at them they actually forgot About them and were quite content
customer_reviews.author: MelWend

customer_reviews.title: No more scratching the sofa!!
customer_reviews.text: I was super reluctant to get these because I thought it would be a mess, difficult to put on my 5 month old kittens and just altogether a waste of time. But it actually was not. The cats were great and the product was very easy to use. The tube of glue has a needle nose thing to stick in the nail to make it easy. It is really simple. The nails are thick and shiny. I will always buy these for my cats, and if you have cats. It keeps them from scratching everything in the house.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanytheShoppist🔥

customer_reviews.title: Save your furniture, and don't declaw.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to declaw my cats, as it is wicked. Clip your cats claws, apply glue inside the claw cap, and apply to cat's claws. Hold and cuddle your cat for about 5 minutes, to allow the glue to set. One of my cat's claws grew at an alarming rate, which can push the claw caps off. When you find a loose one on the floor around the house, reapply them. Cheaper than a new couch. We tried all the other methods: foil, citrus, sticky tape, water pistol, relaxation sprays, and they even have a HUGE scratching post, but they found the couch better.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but tips of caps can break off
customer_reviews.text: These caps don’t bother my feline fur babies at all. The only thing I don’t like is that the tips seem to break off if the kittens claws are long enough. The rest of the cap is still adhering to my kitten’s claws, and it doesn’t seem hurt him or make him uncomfortable. So, the one thing I would say is that it might be helpful to let the claws grow out enough to fill most of the cap. It can be a little difficult, because I did fit the caps before adhering them, but some claws seem to grow faster than others.
customer_reviews.author: Krob

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these nail covers in hopes it would save our carpet. My cats kneed the carpet and stairs during the night and my husband was talking about getting them de-clawed. :( This has helped greatly. It takes 2 of us to put them on - me holding the cat and my husband filling the cap with glue, and I apply. Two of them tried to chew them off but haven't been successful. Size Medium was perfect for our cats who are 12-14 lbs. They can still kneed but it isn't harming the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: MollyQ

customer_reviews.title: I ordered medium & they were pretty big for my cats
customer_reviews.text: The size runs big. I ordered medium & they were pretty big for my cats. The material is also very soft, my cats chewed off the tips of the naps & left the base glued on. The price is much better than when buying in the store, however the store’s material is much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Best cat nail caps I have ever bought!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best nail caps I have ever purchased!!! The package Has a nice amount of glue included with the nail caps and I really appreciate that as well. They stay on my cat for about a month then fall off and I just replace. I love these best purchase of cat nail caps I have made and believe me I have tried a lot of different ones this is by far the best!!!! Price can’t be beat as well definitely a plus and a must buy for a cat owner looking to try a friendly approach to stop the scratching of you or your furniture and in my case walls....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these!!! Our cat is a year old and she weighs 7.5 pounds, I got the small size. She was pretty good about not scratching, but she had one chair she loves to scratch. My fiancée wants me to declaw her, but I wanted to try these first. They were super easy to put on and I was able to do it by myself. She licked her paws for a few hours after I put them on. She is totally used to them now. It’s been 3 days since I put them on and none have come off yet and she acts like nothin g has changed.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Uneven, odd shapes, some annoy cat, easily taken off
customer_reviews.text: First of all wishing I could have chosen the colors but it's not a big deal I suppose. These things are very cheap. Some of them are bulkier or bigger than others and may be more uncomfortable for the cat. My cat tore one off within hours, I think she wasn't comfortable with it because I put a new one on and she was fine. Some of the caps are already looking chewed and beat up and I just put them on. Overall, not great. Okay, but not great. Might be better if you could choose the colors but as it stands you can get the same product for cheaper elsewhere. Or get something of a much higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use furniture savers
customer_reviews.text: After our cats destroyed a leather sofa we needed a way to protect the furniture from their scratching. Even multiple scratching posts didn't stop them from using our chairs and other furniture, so I decided to give these a try. What a difference it made! The first few applications were difficult while we learned how to hold the cats and apply the covers quickly, but since getting over that learning curve it has been such a breeze. I only use them on the front claws, but they can be used on both front and back if you like.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Elwart

customer_reviews.title: Greatest cat invention ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m only upset I didn’t buy these sooner and save my leather couch from the onslaught of cat scratching!! These work FANTASTICALLY and I was impressed with the ease of applying them.. she’s had them on for well over a week and they’re still going strong without any replacements needed. I fully expected her to have a fit about them being on, she did shake her paws for a few minutes and walked a little weird at first but she quickly adjusted and now she cleans them just like they were claws. This is seriously the best invention ever!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap and come in LARGE
customer_reviews.text: Not similar to soft paws at all. They are a flimsy rubber instead of a hard plastic. I would not recommend this product to anybody and spend the few extra dollar are real soft paws that will last 4 months. It's not worth the saving using these when the claws actually grow through the these cheap rubber nails and only useful for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wish I wouldn't have bought
customer_reviews.text: I really don't think these are safe, in my opinion. I am not experienced in putting on nails and don't wear artificial nails but thought I would give them a try for my kittens. I put one on and she was biting it off for hours pulling on it and going crazy I had to clip it down now I can't get out off. I feel horrible. The instructions are so small you need a magnifying glass ro read it. No instructions to remove the tips.
customer_reviews.author: LisaD129

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: Adopted a 6 year old Siamese in January. Had serious problems with his "play clawing" me. I take a blood thinner and thought about bringing him back to Save A Pet. But he is so affectionate and I wanted to keep him if possible. My friend did a "google" and found these!..Took him to the vet and they applied them and showed me how. Haven't tried it yet, but he lets me trim his claws so I think he will be okay with me applying these. If not, the vet will do it. I am so thankful that someone invented these!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: I reorder these and recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these more than once. And a friend just bought them after my recommendation. I find these easy to put on for my kitties. I like the kit. My cats have worn soft paws for years. Really saves my skin, clothes, and furniture. I love the different colors. I often mix and match for holidays. I wish they tasted bad as I have one kitty that likes to chew on them. It’s so easy to replace the one or two when he manages to get them off. Always enough glue. My sets last 2-3 months. I buy medium size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work as well as the $20 brands
customer_reviews.text: These are the same covers you will pay over $20 for at a Petco or Petsmart. Yes, they are still made in China. If you accidentally order a size that is too long for your cat's claws, these can be conveniently trimmed from the open end for a perfect fit. My cats do not like the process of getting these on per se but they tolerate it and once they are on, they stay on for 2-4 weeks and seem to fall off without damaging the nails. The colors are also great because you can always keep track of which nails are newly covered vs. older ones.
customer_reviews.author: L. Zucker

customer_reviews.title: Genius invention!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew these existed! My college daughter got a tiny kitten. She rides not want to declaw him but....kittens. And he has sharp claws! These are soft silicone “caps” that she glued on to his claw! It prevents his sharp little nails from cutting everything they come into contact with and they stay on nicely. He doesn’t even act like he has them on! This is genius, why didn’t I think to invent these?
customer_reviews.author: dblomom

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: OK these are super super cute, I read reviews and someone said that they were stiff and too difficult to apply. They are soft and squishy. It is difficult for one person to do as I glued my fingers to my face and my leg during the process of trying to hold my cat. I have to re-apply as one of my cats has chewed them all off... I got them because of the cat fights and scratches they were giving one another.
customer_reviews.author: Summer B.

customer_reviews.title: Will order again
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my cats. Put them on about a month ago and most are still on my older cat. Our kitten chewed his off, but I still believe the integrity of the product is good. I used kitten caps on both of my cats- kitten caps were fine on my adult cat. I did trim the caps to shorten them so that my cats could still comfortably retract their claws. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: They are very easy to put on and did not hurt him
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was 10 months old when we put these on. They are very easy to put on and did not hurt him. However, I think he was embarrassed to have his nails colored, so he kept chewing them off. Our cat does love to chew so it could just be him that will do this. However, the ones he has not tried to take off, they have stayed on well for about 3 weeks each.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet L.

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to declawing
customer_reviews.text: Definitely takes two people to put this on your cat. You have to be very careful putting it on so that it doesn’t get on the cats hair or goes on wrong. I got some on my cat and it ended up pulling out her hair and the glue got on my finger, it does burn some so be careful not to burn yourself or your kitty. It has stayed in place for a few days now so not sure how long it will last. However a few of the nails she managed to bite the tips off. I do think this is a better alternative than getting them declawed but MUST be applied with caution!
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: My cat would not tolerate them.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my cat was not happy having these put on her claws, so I was only able to get 4 glued on. Of those 4, 2 fell off the next day and she chewed one more off. The last one is still hanging on 2 weeks later. I found these difficult to judge how much glue to use, and how on earth NOT to catch her fur in it. I'll have to find another way of keeping her from ripping her face off due to allergies. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sharon D.

customer_reviews.title: These work pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: My first time putting them on I wasn't diligent about making sure hair didn't get glued on as well as the covers. This was a mistake. Kitten was unhappy and ripped them off hair and all :( The ones that just went on the toes hold on well. I brushed him for about 5 minutes to distract while the glue dried (Not sure if it takes that long but it worked out well for us) After an adjustment period he didn't seem to mind them
customer_reviews.author: Shannon in NH

customer_reviews.title: Great product, no more ripped carpet/furniture
customer_reviews.text: These nails are a great idea. No more damaged furniture/carpet from the pet scratching. It does take two people though to get the nails on. One to hold and another to glue the nails on. The cat walked funny for a few minutes then quickly adjusted. Each pair will stay on about 3 weeks. The glue is quick drying so once applied they will stay on. Cat can still do their normal routine, the nails do not interfere. Love all the colors too.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaAnn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay on
customer_reviews.text: Pros: she hasn’t shredded any paper towels or done as much damage to the couch. Cons: she pulled three off within a day of application and within four days I’ve replaced approximately six nails and she’s bitten a hole in the tip of two more. Made her paws sensitive and she walked a little funny until she bit off one of the nails and I was able to replace it. She also does not want to play and is not as active as she was before the nails were applied.
customer_reviews.author: Bogiefan1995

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: These claw caps are a life saver! My cat was scratching the walls, furnature, carpet, you name it he was clawing it up. Not anymore! They were so easy to apply and the best part is he can't scratch my friends and family anymore. Declawing your cats is cruel. This way, you can still get the same results as a declaw for less money and your cat will thank you. I absolutely reccomend these to all cat owners!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cat but a good product
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated putting these on, as expected, but he got use to them within a few days. It’s great to keep him from pulling down my towels, scratching me up when he lays on me, and scratching the walls HOWEVER he also has many scratching posts and he seems very upset with not being able to scratch at them. I figured they would fall off pretty quickly, but they’ve been on for 3 weeks + and his nails have begun to grown through them. The adhesive is great but a little too strong!! I wouldn’t buy again just because he disliked them, but great alternative to declawing!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We have an extra large cat, his claws are huge! We ordered the large size and they lost didn't cover his entire nail, but they covered the tip and stayed on pretty well! He took off 3 at first, but I used a little more glue and he only managed to get one off all night. These are perfect! The glue has a strong smell but can't be stronger than nail glue for press on nails.
customer_reviews.author: Katja

customer_reviews.title: Will not be repurchasing...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using “claw caps” for years. Usually, I use a brand called “Kitty Caps”, but the deal on this bundle was too good to pass up. Well, you know what they say- if it’s too good to be true, it probably is. Lesson learned. The material used is much thinner than the brand I usually use. I ordered Medium, but the sizes were very, very inconsistent and my cats managed to chew off the ends of several of them- something I have never experienced in the 10+ years I’ve been using them. So, I’ll finish the bundle I have, but I won’t be repurchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Not tough enough. Cat chews them right off.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not happy with these at all. We’ve used the clear ones from a chain pet store and they worked great, so I thought how fun it would be to have some pretty colors. But the ones from the pet store are harder plastic and these are more squishy, and I’m not sure if that’s why but my cat has systematically chewed the tips all but one cap off (and a couple completely off) within 24 hours. Now I’m paranoid that she’s swallowed them and guess I’ll take her to the vet to see if everything is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Corrie

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your skills
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly as described and the glue is worse than super glue so be careful!! My cats HATED these and chewed them off and the only way I could glue them was to feed them wet food.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Price

customer_reviews.title: buy Them and try them!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg I was so skeptical with these... but wow so easy to put on (my cat always sits with me and very easy going) I didn't Think they would last but we're on day five and they're still on and when he tries to Scratch my brand new leather couch he's just padding on it wish I had them earlier so I don't have scratch marks all over my brand new couch
customer_reviews.author: Jeni

customer_reviews.title: Easy cute fill only half way to be able to clip onto the nail bed and not just the tips
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the coolest thing ever and the best alternative to declawing. Fill it half way so that it can clip onto the nail bed and not just the nail tips because then it will come off soon and once you already attached it you can't fix it without the car getting aggy. I love it my kitten doesn't even notice them... And it makes her paws look pretty would def but again totally worth the money.. Easier with two people
customer_reviews.author: Love

customer_reviews.title: I love theses! They saved my sofa and everything else!
customer_reviews.text: It lasts about 1-2 months. I have 3 cats and put in all three. It is strong. Cats hated it first of course but go used to it. Sometimes it will randomly fall and you will just need to keep replacing them. I have one of my cats who really makes her objective of each day to get rid of her caps. She is very persistent but the others don't even bother anymore. I think this is perfect, really. To be the best it would be awesome to even last more. But I feel happy and would buy again and again. it is a relief to your furniture
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Turns cat into demon
customer_reviews.text: If you want your cats to absolutely hate you, this is the product. Putting these on was worse than wrestling an alligator. My sweet cat turned into a demon. I put these on all three of my cats and took me forever to do. I had to lock them in a room so they couldn’t run off. If I could pay someone to put these on, it would be so much better. If you want your cat to growl at you, then buy this. So far they seem pretty sturdy. I’m not sure how long they will last though
customer_reviews.author: Meyer

customer_reviews.title: wish it either came with more glue, or glue wouldn’t dry out.
customer_reviews.text: love these for my cat that can’t retract her claws. she used to get stuck on everything because her claws are always out. these claw caps have improved my cats quality of life. much better alternative than declawing. the only downside to this product in specific: it comes with 3 tubes of glue, but they dry out very easily, even if you secure the cap perfectly. i still have a lot of claw caps left and i’m worried about running out of adhesive for the caps.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Jiskra

customer_reviews.title: 🐱🐱meow🐱🐱
customer_reviews.text: My cat hates cutting her nails period so it was a little bit hard to put them on. I needed my moms assistance to help put on the back paws. The first day of two my cat would walk funny and try to chew them off. I do think they work tho because she’s not able to scratch my stuff like before ! I really like them plus she looks super boujee and cute cat 🐱
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella pedraza

customer_reviews.title: Work great, lasted for 2 weeks on our highly active kittens!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My cats only keep them on for about 2 weeks at a time but they are pretty active during the day and play together a lot. I think a single cat might keep them on longer. I think as long as you are willing to keep up with the nail maintenance, they work great. Our kittens like to scratch on doors and they often run/jump/play on our couches, so these are wonderful for preventing scratches caused by their nails. For reference, my cats are almost 5 months old and I ordered the Small size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toxic Glue
customer_reviews.text: My cat threw up and now has foam coming out of his mouth after he licked semi dry glue. Thought it was non toxic. The glue accidentally leaked out of the nail when he kept moving around while I was trying to put a nail on him and he licked it even after a minute. This isn't for all cats. If you have a lazy cat that doesn't care then this would be easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: MizzWicked

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how I feel about these
customer_reviews.text: First impression exactly as expected and there super cute. I have three cats and I put them on the most laid back one first. He was not happy about it and cried but after they were done he left them alone.My second cat let me put them on then after they were on she literally chewed off 3 of her nails to get these off so now i dont want to put them on the third. I want to use these but im not sure how safe they are.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: These are great if you have a chill cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat is pretty laid back and let's us hold her in whatever position we want without much complaint. So putting these on her claws was no problem! I just cradle her like a baby and stick them on. They don't seem to bother her and last a good while. However, if your cat is not one to let you hold him/her or mess with their paws, these may not work out for you.
customer_reviews.author: ETPark

customer_reviews.title: FURNITURE LIFESAVER!
customer_reviews.text: Holy guacamole....if your cat/kitten is terrorizing your furniture, curtains, headboard, or walls then this is for you!! Easy application and I try to put on one nail at a time then reward my cat with a treat. It is important to distract them for a few minutes while the glue dries else they'll run and hide, shake their paws, and try to tear the nail off. My advice would be to do it in a bathroom or room where they can't run off and have some toys around to distract them. Not much glue is needed either! WORTH THE BUY!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet McIndoe

customer_reviews.title: kitty claw covers
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty skittish cat (who doesn't like me all that much) but I didn't have much trouble putting these tips on. However, kitten immediately began to gnaw at them. She had removed most of them within a few days. I have not put any more on her. I thought I would wait and try again with a kitten when I get one and see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: These work for their intended purpose. To keep your cat from scratching the heck out of everything. Ease of use rating is low because come on, have you ever tried to do anything to a cat that they don't want?? That's not a product fault though. Thickness and feeling seem comparable to name brand. Cat still tries to chew them off.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: These were super easy to apply! I just used a human nail clippers to clip my cats nails down to size and these fit perfectly! I did have to keep a close eye on my cat for 10-15 minutes afterwards to ensure he didn't chew them off. It's been over a week and they are still firmly in place. These saved my curtains and furniture! Absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is really good! The glue works very well and almost instantly
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time trying these out for my kitty. The product itself is really good! The glue works very well and almost instantly. The nail caps are easy to put on if your kitty is cooperative. My kitty is 6 months now and is about 5.5lbs. The small is a great fit for him. The set comes in 5 sets of 20s with plenty of glue sticks, and instructions. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nava

customer_reviews.title: They are okay
customer_reviews.text: My cat is still learning to get use to the caps. He has to wear them all the time. But these caps are a little fragile. One of the caps broke in half after one day (Exposing the cat's claw... Cat's claw was fine, I checked). The others kinda seem to suffer ware and tear too easily. I've never had this problem with caps being so fragile before. I mean they stay on with the adhesive and don't seem to harm the cat at all. But I don't think I'll be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Infinity

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are so awesome! I’ve never used them before and I put them on my new kitty and he seems very comfortable! Definitely will keep purchasing when I run out which will be in a while because it comes with so many! Only downfall is you can’t see how much glue you are putting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love and a Must
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying. 1st round kitten, applied myself. Kept losing some every few days here and there. This round next size range purchase, had petco apply them. Only 2 came off the first week. 8 still on 3 weeks later. Life saver otherwise for furniture and family member on blood thinners. Great alternative to declawing.
customer_reviews.author: snoop176

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: We didn't want to declaw our cat and didn't think there was any other alternative. We had multiple "casualties" with our dog, our children and our furniture. I saw these and thought what the heck, might as well give em a try. Put the nail caps on and voila! No torn puppy ears, no crying kids from being scratched, and my furniture is safe! Best of all, other than application (definitely a two person job), they don't bother the cat and they look super cute. These nail caps have been the perfect solution for our feisty cat. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Wendt

customer_reviews.title: They run large
customer_reviews.text: I have used Soft Claws prior in a small. I ordered these in small too and they are too big. Also, they do not have the cleat system that the Soft Claw brand does that hold the cover on much longer. I wanted to save money but the time and effort that it takes to put these tiny covers on a squirmy cat is something I don't want to do too often. See the picture of the pink VITCHY small covers and the clear Soft Paws Small cover. What a huge difference!
customer_reviews.author: Aiink

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy
customer_reviews.text: These things are alittle tricky to put on, it's def a 2 person job. But the directions are easy to follow, the caps look cute as heck on the cats and if it wasn't for them chewing on them so much they would be lasting a bit longer. Right now with my boys I'm getting alittle over 2 weeks out of them, some caps hold on longer but I'm having to replace a few every other week it seems. However! There has been NO carpet or furniture scratching since we started using these 👍
customer_reviews.author: Heather H

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you don't have a feisty cat!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea but with our cat....oh no he was not having them!!! He was going to do anything he could to not let me put them on. I only gave 2 stars because I truly did not get to try them. My girlfriend and her cat, well, they gave 5 stars and worked great....her cat was nothing like our fiesty little cat!!
customer_reviews.author: Me, Ms. G

customer_reviews.title: Great way to save furniture!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great with saving furniture and other things our kitty shouldn't be tearing up. Doesn't stop him from his normal day-to-day activities at all. Were a little stressful to get on the first time, and he tried to chew them off for a few days, but he definitely got used to it. They also look adorable all the time! We just put them on the front paws, which works nicely. Would definitely recommend following the instructions and tips for application provided!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chewed through one in no time
customer_reviews.text: Jury is still out as it’s been less than a day since application. Within a couple hours, one of our cats managed to chew the tip off a nail cap. I am really hoping the other caps have a longer life on his paws. (Yes, I gave the male cat the pink ones, just because he’s ornery and deserves it!) Edit: cat got impacted nails as a result of the caps, so we won’t use anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Mikala

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect! My cat has ruined a chair and a couch so I decided to get these. He has brittle nails so I hate trimming his nails and these worked amazing! I’ll definitely be telling everyone I know about them! My only concern is that he may try to bite them off and swallow one but he’s had them on almost 24 hours and doesn’t seem to care about them anymore so I don’t think that’ll happen.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Kitten size too big.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these before for my kittens, I've always liked them. But this time I ordered kitten size and im not sure what size I actually got but these are too big! They also don't feel like the same quality as packs I ordered before. Due to the size being to big they were hard to put on the kittens. And they bit the tips off. Waste. I love the concept Ive had four cats that caps like these really worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stops cat scratches!
customer_reviews.text: The soft claws are a tad tricky to get on a wild kitten, who doesn't like to sit still. I had to be patient and do just a few at a time, but I am pleasantly surprised with the results. She's had them on a week, and only lost one. Fair warning be prepared to distract your cat for 10 minutes while the glue is drying, because my kitten wanted to lick them to clean them. Also, the sparkly purple was the only cute color mine came with. The rest are boring colors, so I wish they would let you choose your color packs. I got them to stop her tv scratching, and now she can't.
customer_reviews.author: Rizzy

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy to put on my cat's claws!
customer_reviews.text: Really pleasantly surprised at how easy these are to put on my cat. My cat didn't seem to mind the application process, either. I was really shocked that the caps didn't come off afterwards, because my cat tried to chew them off for a solid 15-20 minutes (she eventually gave up). The glue does dry very quickly, as others have mentioned, so don't put too much in the caps or you may get some on your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Xs not small enough for kitten
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the worst quality but aren't the best, I will be returning. They do come in a nice plastic big for easy and organized storing but I Ordered xs and they were too big and didn't fit my 3 month old kitten. Ordered another brand that fit and a little nicer quality. But if my kitten were bigger and they would have fit. I probably would have just kept them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: heather Gianelloni

customer_reviews.title: If you love your cat, don’t do this
customer_reviews.text: I felt so bad for putting these on my baby’s claws as soon as I finished. It’s clearly really inhumane. I did not think they would make him so miserable. They were impossible to remove and he couldn’t retract his claws for days and weeks until they finally all came off. I will never do this again and I do not recommend it for anyone. I cried multiple times over a period of 3 weeks because my cat was so bothered by these and I felt so guilty for doing that to him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these two months ago. Waited to do this review to make sure these work good. I ordered the XS for my 4 month old kitten and they fit fine. The glue works like it should and the covers are cute!! How well these work truly depends on how they are applied. You need to trim the cats real claws first before gluing the fake claws on. These usually stay on about a week or so before they start coming off. And it’s so much easier to glue these claw covers on while the kitty sleeps, just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Thoughts
customer_reviews.text: Did this product work for what I was trying to do, yes. Was my cat very upset and after a couple of weeks actually tore them off herself, yes. So if you are going for a product like this, this one is good and lots of choices and I believe there were three or four tubes of glue and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: I was worried this would hurt my cat..
customer_reviews.text: Because of other reviews I had read I was worries the adhesive would be painful to and harm my senior cat. I decided to chance it since it is only $10 and I tested the glue on myself first. It didnt burn so I went ahead and applied it to my cats nails after trimming them. Great buy! It has saved my couch some damage and overall isnt hard to apply. After putting about two full sets on him, my cat doesnt try to hard to remove them anymore. Great purchase for the price and it will last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Happy with what I have
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these while my cat was healing from some skin issues. I am super happy with what they have. The only concern I have is (maybe this is just my cat), but my cat was able to get them off after about a week. He didn't do any damage to his nail, which was a wonderful, but just wanted to give a heads up that if your cat is a mastermind and wants them off, they may be able to succeed.
customer_reviews.author: ARaymond

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to apply and the adhesive works amazingly! While my cats are upset they can’t sharpen their nails anymore on my couches, they are completely comfortable wearing them. I sat with my cats individually and got them purring before even attempting to apply them. I highly suggest soothing them in advance to avoid them going haywire :) Oh, they’re so adorable it’s ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Anna

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical at first, as I saw mixed reviews. But it was this or declawing, which I really didn’t want to do. They’re pretty simple to put on, but if your cat is particularly against having their paws messed with, I would advise a 2 person approach. My cat absolutely didn’t care that these were on his claws, and plays like normal. No chewing or funny walking like other reviews mentioned. It took him a few days to learn that he could no longer use his claws for climbing, but it definitely didn’t deter him from playing/jumping. I LOVE these!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with these
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with these. One of my cats likes to get in bed with me at night and knead my belly which feels like little needles being poked in my skin. These caps solved this issue completely! The best part is my cat doesn't seem to mind them at all. They are easy to apply and stay on for about 4 weeks. Love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ideas-Cowan

customer_reviews.title: work great
customer_reviews.text: these work great for cats. it stopped my cat from clawing and now that she is older does not claw at all. they stay on for a long time. get good nail clippers and clip their nails before putting these on and also trim hair on the paws when going to glue them on if your cat has long hair I recommend last over 3 months on yes one may fall off but put a new cap on or just let them fall off only had to put them on my cat twice in a year because she quit scratching
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Latvamaki

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in 2 different sizes to use on my 3 adult cats. They were easy to apply even with them squirming, just did it a couple nails at a time. They lasted for about 2 months overall before needingto be redone. Saved my furniture and my cats didnt even seem to notice them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gioia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price, ymmv
customer_reviews.text: These are nice but don’t seem to stay on as long as they maybe should. We have to keep gluing them on every week or so. But once on they do keep the cat from scratching up our furniture. Mix and match to give the cat a cool nail look
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: VICTHY 100 PCS Soft Pet Cat Nail Caps Cats Paws Grooming Nail Claws Caps Covers of 5 Random 5Pcs Adhesive Glue with 5pcs Applicators
feature_bullets: 【Perfect Nails Caps】Only for cat use. Mudium Size, Suit for 11 lb-16.5 lb cat and kitten. Easy-to-apply caps last 4-6 weeks. If the nail caps didn't fit your cat or you have anything questions to VICTHY cat nail caps, we support replacement or 100% refund.

【100% Safe】Our soft nail caps and adhesive glue have passed the EU's SGS environmental certification, no-toxic, durable, Natural, comfortable, will not interfere with your cat's normal behavior. Majority of cats can adapt quickly. Your cat maybe not adapt it when applied for the first time. Maybe she will bite or try to take it off, try to distract your kitty. usually applied for few times, they will adapt it. if your cat swallowed the caps, don't worry, our caps are Safe and non-toxic, No hurt.

【Multifunction】Animals enter estrus and begin to get grumpy in spring. It is a good items to effectively prevention of cat scratch disease, beneficial to cat claw carry out care. Avoid cat scratches the affected area with skin disease, Protect your cat itself and protect you when play with them. You will never worried you will get hurt and it won't destroy you clothing. Protect your homes and furniture against destructive scratching by applying soft claws nail caps to kittens nails.

【How to Use】Firstly trim cat's nails to fit the nail caps properly, then fill the nail caps with glue, after that extend the cat claws softly and put the caps onto nails, finally observe several minutes before release the cat to make sure the nail covers are attached closely. NOTE: Don't trim kitten's nail. The nail caps can't attach closely, if you trim kitten's nail, sincekitten's nails are too small.

【Package included】100pcs cat nail tips in 1 Pack with 5 Adhesive Glue and 5pcs Applicators. 5 Different Colors Random, If you need to take the nail caps off from your cat claw, could use nail varnish remover or dispergator.
